siteDescription: Community Network project to provide public tools for different games. Starting with Battlefield, we bringing back BF online playercount stats, as well as personal stats and much more in future.

0.question: Q: Can I use your API?
0.answer: A: Yes, you can. We provide free API without any limitation.

1.question: Q: You have a Discord bot, but can I make my own?
1.answer: A: We provide great bot for Discord, but if you want to write your own - be free to do so with APIs.

2.question: Q: Which games are available?
2.answer: A: Our website and API support most of Battlefield games including V, 1, 4, HL, 3 and 2. The Discord bot exclusively support some other games like Division or Destiny 2.

3.question: Q: Did you use to BF tracker to build it?
3.answer: A: No. We provide independent services.

4.question: Q: I found an issue or want to suggest changes on the website, where do I need to post it?
4.answer: A: Use our GitHub to post any issues and suggestions.

5.question: Q: Where to post issues and feature requests for Bot?
5.answer: A: For Bot & API use our Discord.

search.description: Search for Origin Nickname to get player stats on PC.

stats.overviewDescription: See your overview stats in game.

descriptions.0: Website is part of the Community Network. Product is Open Source. You can post issues and suggest new code in our GitHub repository. API provided by Community Network and open for public usage. We don’t provide any third-party API. Our backend closed and restricted for public view.
descriptions.1: Battlefield & Origin are registered trademark of Electronic Arts. This website uses data provided pursuant to Electronic Arts’ Battlefield 1 Stats Terms. Trademarks are the property of their respective owners. Game materials copyright Electronic Arts Inc. Electronic Arts has not endorsed and is not responsible for this site or its content.
descriptions.2: Code is under GPL v2 License. Some parts are under Community Network copyright.
